Things to know about virus threats to your computer
Spanish : know about virus threats to your computer
Things to know about virus threats to your computer
Computer hardware and software is evolving.
Spanish : ardware and software is evolving.
Computer hardware and software is evolving.

Today's computer viruses have become sophisticated beings (yes, they're almost alive). Did you know that some viruses don't require any action on your side in order to take full control over your computer?

Spanish : mputer viruses have become sophisticated beings (yes, they're almost alive). Did you know that some viruses don't require any action on your side in order to take full control over your computer?

Today's computer viruses have become sophisticated beings (yes, they're almost alive). Did you know that some viruses don't require any action on your side in order to take full control over your computer?
Yes, you don't really need to click on anything or accept any file.
Spanish : on't really need to click on anything or accept any file.
Yes, you don't really need to click on anything or accept any file.
You'll not be asked to approve anything - and until it's very late, you'll not even be aware of your new companion.
Spanish : be asked to approve anything - and until it's very late, you'll not even be aware of your new companion.
You'll not be asked to approve anything - and until it's very late, you'll not even be aware of your new companion.
But when that dormant Virus, which installed on your PC, triggers and start working on your computer - that's too late.
Spanish : hat dormant Virus, which installed on your PC, triggers and start working on your computer - that's too late.
But when that dormant Virus, which installed on your PC, triggers and start working on your computer - that's too late.
Combined virus attacks are a relatively new term, describing viruses that crawl into your computer in a few steps.
Spanish : irus attacks are a relatively new term, describing viruses that crawl into your computer in a few steps.
Combined virus attacks are a relatively new term, describing viruses that crawl into your computer in a few steps.
First, the virus has to get to your computer. That's very easy.
Spanish : virus has to get to your computer. That's very easy.
First, the virus has to get to your computer. That's very easy.
Receive a malicious email or browse a hostile web site.
Spanish : malicious email or browse a hostile web site.
Receive a malicious email or browse a hostile web site.
Not much action is required from your side.
Spanish : ction is required from your side.
Not much action is required from your side.
Just opening an email (you don't have to activate any attachment) or entering a site is enough.
Spanish : ng an email (you don't have to activate any attachment) or entering a site is enough.
Just opening an email (you don't have to activate any attachment) or entering a site is enough.
The virus puts a piece of dangerous code on your computer, camouflaged as a harmless piece of information.
Spanish : puts a piece of dangerous code on your computer, camouflaged as a harmless piece of information.
The virus puts a piece of dangerous code on your computer, camouflaged as a harmless piece of information.
Since no virus is actually conveyed during this step, your favorite AV software will probably take no action and report nothing.
Spanish : irus is actually conveyed during this step, your favorite AV software will probably take no action and report nothing.
Since no virus is actually conveyed during this step, your favorite AV software will probably take no action and report nothing.
The next few steps are more interesting.
Spanish : ew steps are more interesting.
The next few steps are more interesting.
A very dangerous piece of code resides in your hard disk, but is still dormant - it doesn't run and doesn't cause any damage - yet...
Spanish : gerous piece of code resides in your hard disk, but is still dormant - it doesn't run and doesn't cause any damage - yet...
A very dangerous piece of code resides in your hard disk, but is still dormant - it doesn't run and doesn't cause any damage - yet...
Then, another, harmlessly looking site or email triggers the dormant code.
Spanish : her, harmlessly looking site or email triggers the dormant code.
Then, another, harmlessly looking site or email triggers the dormant code.
Again, your AV software doesn't really notice that because the piece of code is already on your computer.
Spanish : r AV software doesn't really notice that because the piece of code is already on your computer.
Again, your AV software doesn't really notice that because the piece of code is already on your computer.
The AV software would usually just scan code that is downloaded and executed from the Internet.
Spanish : tware would usually just scan code that is downloaded and executed from the Internet.
The AV software would usually just scan code that is downloaded and executed from the Internet.
It usually trusts code that's already on your computer.
Spanish : trusts code that's already on your computer.
It usually trusts code that's already on your computer.
Of course, it you have a firewall installed - that doesn't do you any good against this attack.
Spanish : it you have a firewall installed - that doesn't do you any good against this attack.
Of course, it you have a firewall installed - that doesn't do you any good against this attack.
The application, which triggers the virus is legitimate and has full rights to access the Internet.
Spanish : ation, which triggers the virus is legitimate and has full rights to access the Internet.
The application, which triggers the virus is legitimate and has full rights to access the Internet.
Last but not least - the virus has to be executed on your computer.
Spanish : ot least - the virus has to be executed on your computer.
Last but not least - the virus has to be executed on your computer.
This last step requires assistance from a giant - Microsoft.
Spanish : step requires assistance from a giant - Microsoft.
This last step requires assistance from a giant - Microsoft.
Writing a web-browser is a complicated task.
Spanish : web-browser is a complicated task.
Writing a web-browser is a complicated task.
It involves work from thousands of programmers.
Spanish : s work from thousands of programmers.
It involves work from thousands of programmers.
Such a complicated task is never flawless - and some bugs remain here and there.
Spanish : plicated task is never flawless - and some bugs remain here and there.
Such a complicated task is never flawless - and some bugs remain here and there.
Computer hackers recognize these bugs and use them to make Microsoft's Internet Explorer to do things it wasn't intended to do.
Spanish : ackers recognize these bugs and use them to make Microsoft's Internet Explorer to do things it wasn't intended to do.
Computer hackers recognize these bugs and use them to make Microsoft's Internet Explorer to do things it wasn't intended to do.
Specifically, these bugs allow hackers to wake up (or trigger) dormant virus code on your computer.
Spanish : ly, these bugs allow hackers to wake up (or trigger) dormant virus code on your computer.
Specifically, these bugs allow hackers to wake up (or trigger) dormant virus code on your computer.
And then, your new visitor - the virus - can do whatever it feels like doing.
Spanish : your new visitor - the virus - can do whatever it feels like doing.
And then, your new visitor - the virus - can do whatever it feels like doing.
Having administrative privileges, the new owner of your computer can have a look at your files, send them, change them - but most popular of all - simply erase them.
Spanish : inistrative privileges, the new owner of your computer can have a look at your files, send them, change them - but most popular of all - simply erase them.
Having administrative privileges, the new owner of your computer can have a look at your files, send them, change them - but most popular of all - simply erase them.
There are a few things that you can do to protect from computer viruses.
Spanish : a few things that you can do to protect from computer viruses.
There are a few things that you can do to protect from computer viruses.
The key to protecting your computer is in understanding that no solution is perfect and that you should always trust your common sense before anything else.
Spanish : protecting your computer is in understanding that no solution is perfect and that you should always trust your common sense before anything else.
The key to protecting your computer is in understanding that no solution is perfect and that you should always trust your common sense before anything else.
Then, there are some technical things that can be done:
Spanish : e are some technical things that can be done:
Then, there are some technical things that can be done:
Get anti-virus software and use it frequently. Keep it updated.
Spanish : irus software and use it frequently. Keep it updated.
Get anti-virus software and use it frequently. Keep it updated.
Visit only known sites and don't follow random links.
Spanish : known sites and don't follow random links.
Visit only known sites and don't follow random links.
Open emails from trusted sources only, and from them also - try to understand if you're looking at legitimate email or at Spam/viruses (they go together hand in hand).
Spanish : s from trusted sources only, and from them also - try to understand if you're looking at legitimate email or at Spam/viruses (they go together hand in hand).
Open emails from trusted sources only, and from them also - try to understand if you're looking at legitimate email or at Spam/viruses (they go together hand in hand).
Delete the contents of your temporary Internet contents, and Recycle Bin frequently - this is a great place for viruses to hold their very private data, which goes undetected.
Spanish : contents of your temporary Internet contents, and Recycle Bin frequently - this is a great place for viruses to hold their very private data, which goes undetected.
Delete the contents of your temporary Internet contents, and Recycle Bin frequently - this is a great place for viruses to hold their very private data, which goes undetected.
Keep up-to-date on modern virus techniques.
Keep up-to-date on modern virus techniques.
You can read non-technical descriptions at plenty of site, like McAfee.
Spanish : ad non-technical descriptions at plenty of site, like McAfee.
You can read non-technical descriptions at plenty of site, like McAfee.
And last, keep in mind that there's always a change that a virus will hit you.
Spanish : keep in mind that there's always a change that a virus will hit you.
And last, keep in mind that there's always a change that a virus will hit you.
Keep your data backed up at all times.
Spanish : data backed up at all times.
Keep your data backed up at all times.
Backup your work files, pictures and photographs, music and every other piece of data you'll need in case you need to setup your computer from scratch.
Spanish : r work files, pictures and photographs, music and every other piece of data you'll need in case you need to setup your computer from scratch.
Backup your work files, pictures and photographs, music and every other piece of data you'll need in case you need to setup your computer from scratch.
Your backup should be to a remote media.
Spanish : p should be to a remote media.
Your backup should be to a remote media.

Remote FTP would work fine, but for Gigabytes of photographs data, you should consider backing up to CDs / DVDs. After making backup, don't forget to verify your data, so that when you need it, you can be sure that it's there!

Spanish : would work fine, but for Gigabytes of photographs data, you should consider backing up to CDs / DVDs. After making backup, don't forget to verify your data, so that when you need it, you can be sure that it's there!

How do I enable DMA mode on CD and DVD burner drives?

How do I enable DMA mode on CD and DVD burner drives?

This document describes how to enable DMA operation for CD or DVD burner drives, regardless of the burning software you use. It includes screenshots of Windows XP. Windows 2000 setup is very similar with the same screens. For Windows 98 and Windows Me slightly different windows are involved.

DMA (Direct memory access) mode is a high performance mode for transferring data to and from devices, in particular, to CD and DVD burner devices.
Spanish : t memory access) mode is a high performance mode for transferring data to and from devices, in particular, to CD and DVD burner devices.
DMA (Direct memory access) mode is a high performance mode for transferring data to and from devices, in particular, to CD and DVD burner devices.
The burner devices can function in either DMA or PIO modes.
Spanish : devices can function in either DMA or PIO modes.
The burner devices can function in either DMA or PIO modes.
DMA mode allows the processor to transfer large pieces of data with very little software overhead - therefore requiring low CPU utilization.
Spanish : llows the processor to transfer large pieces of data with very little software overhead - therefore requiring low CPU utilization.
DMA mode allows the processor to transfer large pieces of data with very little software overhead - therefore requiring low CPU utilization.
In this mode, high speed burning can be performed in background with other programs running.
Spanish : de, high speed burning can be performed in background with other programs running.
In this mode, high speed burning can be performed in background with other programs running.
PIO mode requires CPU processing for every few bytes sent to the device, so that CPU utilization becomes very high when trying to burn at high speeds.

PIO mode requires CPU processing for every few bytes sent to the device, so that CPU utilization becomes very high when trying to burn at high speeds.

We've all seen an otherwise gorgeous photograph ruined by red-eye, that curious effect where the pupil of the eye appears to be red rather than black when the photo is taken with a camera using a flash.

Spanish : seen an otherwise gorgeous photograph ruined by red-eye, that curious effect where the pupil of the eye appears to be red rather than black when the photo is taken with a camera using a flash.

We've all seen an otherwise gorgeous photograph ruined by red-eye, that curious effect where the pupil of the eye appears to be red rather than black when the photo is taken with a camera using a flash.
So what causes the dreaded red eye effect? It is caused by the intense light of the flash actually reflecting off of the back of the retina of your photographic subject.
Spanish : uses the dreaded red eye effect? It is caused by the intense light of the flash actually reflecting off of the back of the retina of your photographic subject.
So what causes the dreaded red eye effect? It is caused by the intense light of the flash actually reflecting off of the back of the retina of your photographic subject.
In human beings the effect can be quite dramatic, but it is even more pronounced in many animals.
Spanish : eings the effect can be quite dramatic, but it is even more pronounced in many animals.
In human beings the effect can be quite dramatic, but it is even more pronounced in many animals.

Many animals, including dogs and cats, actually have a special layer on the back of their retinas called tapetum lucidum. This special reflective layer is actually designed to reflect light, it reflects any incoming light outward so that the animal's eye has a second chance to process that available light. While this gives the animal in question much better night vision it also makes any flash photography of these animals difficult even under the best conditions.

The first flash causes the subjects pupils to contract, smaller pupil's means less light reflected from the subject's retina and thus less red eye.

However using a professional image editing package like the Gimp I can load her photograph and use one of its selection tools to select an area around her eyes, the copy just that area to a second layer. This new layer contains only the portion of the image that I have copied, and it allows me to manipulate just that portion of the image while being able to see the rest of the photograph on the layer underneath to get an idea as to the overall effect on the entire finished product. It's like having just that part of the image on top of the other separated by a pane of clear glass. I can erase everything from this top layer except the pupils and irises of her eyes, adjust the color of that layer until the blue matches her natural iris color perfectly, then black out the pupils and merge this layer with the one underneath it.
